etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Geologist. From urano- + -phane, after German Uranophan

definitions: A yellow mineral occurring as an alteration product of uranium ores, typically as crusts or groups of radiating needle-like crystals.

notes.text: Uranophane is a hydrated calcium uranyl silicate, Ca(UO₂)₂(HSiO₄)₂·5H₂O. Crystal system: monoclinic.
